text: I see a lot of Chief Content Officers being brought in from outside the org — they establish that they’re a content magician or a really innovative thinker who makes cool stuff happen in one organization (by doing something like launching a splashy brand mag or totally revamping how they use content) and then they jump to another CCO role at another org. Anyone else seeing this pattern?
